data.title: Sorting colors by brightness
data.statement:
On your screen, colors are coded in [[R]][[G]][[B]] values (Red, Green and Blue values) ranging from 0 to 255. The brightness or luminance of a color can be calculated by the formula {{0.299}}*[[R]] + {{0.587}}*[[G]] + {{0.114}}*[[B]]. This allows to transform a color image into a greyscale image (so actually, on your screen, there can be 256 shades of grey).
Sort the input color by luminance.
The first line of the input will be the number of colors [[n]] to sort. It is followed by [[n]] lines containing a color name and a hash character (#) followed by 6 hexadecimal digits representing its #RRGGBB values separated by a space, for instance:
<<LightCoral #F08080>> means that for that color [[R]]=240, [[G]]=128 and [[B]]=128
Output the color names, one per line, sorted by luminance, rounded down, from the darker one (smaller luminance to the lighter one (greater luminance).

testCases.title: Rainbow
testCases.testIn:
6
OrangeRed #FF4500
Yellow #FFFF00
DarkOrange #FF8C00
LimeGreen #32CD32
DeepSkyBlue #00BFFF
MediumPurple #9370DB
testCases.testOut:
OrangeRed
MediumPurple
LimeGreen
DeepSkyBlue
DarkOrange
Yellow

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
6
Tomato #FF6347
Gold #FFD700
Orange #FFA500
LightGreen #90EE90
DodgerBlue #1E90FF
DarkViolet #9400D3
testCases.testOut:
DarkViolet
DodgerBlue
Tomato
Orange
LightGreen
Gold

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n
read colorName:word(100) RGB:word(7)
loop n
write colorName
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> [[n]] the number of colors
<<Next [[n]] lines :>> [[colorName]] [[RGB]] two space separated strings with [[colorName]] an arbitrary name and [[RGB]] a six-digit hexadecimal number in the {{#RRGGBB}} format (concatenating [[R]], [[G]] and [[B]] coded on two hexadecimal digits)

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

On your screen, colors are coded in RGB values (Red, Green and Blue values) ranging from 0 to 255. The brightness or luminance of a color can be calculated by the formula 0.299*R + 0.587*G + 0.114*B. This allows to transform a color image into a greyscale image (so actually, on your screen, there can be 256 shades of grey).
Sort the input color by luminance.
The first line of the input will be the number of colors n to sort. It is followed by n lines containing a color name and a hash character (#) followed by 6 hexadecimal digits representing its #RRGGBB values separated by a space, for instance:
LightCoral #F08080 means that for that color R=240, G=128 and B=128
Output the color names, one per line, sorted by luminance, rounded down, from the darker one (smaller luminance to the lighter one (greater luminance).
Input
Line 1: n the number of colors
Next n lines : colorName RGB two space separated strings with colorName an arbitrary name and RGB a six-digit hexadecimal number in the #RRGGBB format (concatenating R, G and B coded on two hexadecimal digits)
Output
n lines : the colorName sorted by luminance
Constraints
1 ≤ n ≤ 16
1 ≤ colorName length ≤100
0 ≤ R, G, B ≤ 255
Example
Input
3
LightCoral #F08080
Red #FF0000
IndianRed #CD5C5C
Output
Red
IndianRed
LightCoral
